title: different process  of two gradient functions in DeepEXplainrer and GradientExplainer to deal with None value
body:
hi, I am tring to use the DeepExplainer and GradientExplainer to analyse my pytorch deeplearning model as I am not clearly which explainer is better.
And I find that there is a different different process  of two gradient functions to deal with None value.
1) In DeepExplainer
It can deal with those features not in the gradient graph(**allow_unused=True**) and Nonetype value(**if grad is not None**), as shown in the follow figure:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32454333/102008757-dccbb780-3d6d-11eb-8f58-2bae4c56ab68.png)

also the link: https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/6af9e1008702fb0fab939bf2154bbf93dfe84a16/shap/explainers/_deep/deep_pytorch.py#L100


2) GradientExplainer
 It can not deal with both of them, as below:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32454333/102008838-54014b80-3d6e-11eb-8d6d-e9222325a3c4.png)

also the link: https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/6af9e1008702fb0fab939bf2154bbf93dfe84a16/shap/explainers/_gradient.py#L397

Question:
1) Why "allow_unused=True" and "if grad is not None" are discarded in GradientExplainer?  Do they  have an bad influence to the SHAP value? 
2) And can I modify it when I use GradientExplainer?
3) Are there some principles or rules that can help me choose explainer?

Thank you for your time!
